metadata.title: CVE-2016-9446 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The vmnc decoder in the gstreamer does not initialize the render canvas,which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information asdemonstrated by thumbnailing a simple 1 frame vmnc movie that does not drawto the allocated render canvas.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-bad-1.0 - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-hybris - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-faad - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad-videoparsers - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
libgstreamer-plugins-bad1.0-0 - 1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-bad1.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.2-1ubuntu0.2').
